keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject

headline.print_headline: European Leaders Agree to Strengthen Border Controls Over Migrant Crisis
headline.main: Migrant Crisis Leads to Calls for Tighter Borders in Europe

byline.contributor: James Kanter contributed reporting from Brussels, and Alison Smale from Berlin.

snippet: Gathering in Brussels, European leaders also endorsed a push to get Turkey to control the flow of Syrians and others before they can reach Europe.
abstract: European leaders agree to tighten borders and cooperate with Turkey to halt flow of migrants, reversing earlier, more open approach; Turkish officials seize opportunity to press for financing and visa liberalization for Turks to travel in Europe; refugees who stay despite being refused asylum are also presenting problems.
lead_paragraph: Gathering in Brussels, European leaders also endorsed a push to get Turkey to control the flow of Syrians and others before they can reach Europe.
